Name: King of Orange
Ingredients: 20 ml Grand Marnier or other cognac orange liqueur
Instructions: Select and pre-chill a Flute glass .
Prepare garnish of orange zest twist, shaped to resemble a crown.
EXPRESS orange zest twist over the cocktail and use as garnish.
Review: Bittersweet, with the richness of Grand Marnier balancing the bitter liqueur and lemon juice. (I'm guilty of rebalancing this cocktail and adding the prosecco.)
History: Adapted from a recipe created in 2012 by Dutch bartender Fjalar Goud in honour of King's Day , celebrated across the Netherlands annually on 27th April.
Nutrition: One serving of King of Orange contains 175 calories
